common_issues.title: PiecesOS Bugs and Errors
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with PiecesOS, including failure to generate shareable links, account linking problems, and launch errors.  Troubleshooting steps include checking for duplicate installations, OneDrive interference, and analyzing log files.  The Pieces team is actively working on solutions, including a new authentication system for improved account linking.

related_issues.title: Shareable link is not generating
related_issues.text:
Shareable link is not generating
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/907584e3-3310-4866-bd26-5fbf6e371d62)
Shareable link is not generating . 
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User, 19richa, reported being unable to share a link.
* Pieces Support Bot acknowledged and routed the issue.
* Mark, a Pieces team member, requested the user's email address.
* The issue resolved itself shortly after.

**Problems Identified:**

* 19richa was unable to share a link.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark requested the user's email address.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue resolved itself before a solution could be implemented. 

**Additional Notes:**

* No additional information is available beyond the user's final comment indicating that the issue resolved itself. The cause of the problem and whether it was a temporary glitch or due to user action remains unclear.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Conversation Summary on Account Linking Issue:

**Key Points:**

* John identified an issue with account linking failing despite having distinct accounts for Google and Github.
* John needs his personal domain (set on Google account) to be the main account.
* He wants to avoid unnecessary calls due to his technical expertise.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is subpar and not user-friendly.
* Bug related to separate accounts registered earlier with capital letter mismatch in Google vs Github email address.
* New system is being developed to resolve these issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark suggested merging accounts into John's primary domain (Google) through Github/Google account linking flow.
* John was encouraged to try screen recording the flow for better troubleshooting.
* Mark proposed a tentative solution of resetting Github account and temporarily disabling Github email privacy setting.
* Mark also recommended waiting for the new system to be implemented as it will address these issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Account merging failed due to persistent email capitalization issue.
* Implementation of new system was pushed to early/mid March due to other product release priorities.
* John will be informed again when the new system is closer to release.

**Additional Notes:**

* Existing system uses an old authentication service provider with limitations, prompting a migration to a new one that will handle account linking more effectively.
* Waiting for the new system might be the best course of action to resolve the issue conclusively.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: PiecesOS Launch Issue

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@MR-AAYU) reports `PiecesOS was unable to launch` error.
* User provides logs upon request.
* It's discovered the user has duplicate Pieces for Developers installations.
* User provides additional logs, revealing the issue may be related to OneDrive.

**Problems Identified:**

* Duplicate installation of Pieces for Developers.
* Potential interference from OneDrive.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Analyzing the provided logs.
* Checking for log files in the correct PiecesOS directory.
* Checking for OneDrive interference and suggesting potential solutions.
* Offering a calendar link for further diagnosis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.
* User is requested to provide additional information and schedule a diagnosis session.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user expresses urgency in resolving the issue.
* The support representative, Nathan Courtney, is actively engaged in assisting the user.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS and Pieces for Developers Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report failures to launch PiecesOS or connect to cloud services/local LLMs in Pieces for Developers. Issues often involve network configuration, firewall interference, OneDrive conflicts, or duplicate installations. Solutions include verifying network settings, disabling firewalls, relocating PiecesOS directories, removing duplicate installations, and using smaller LLMs.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Mariusz-kowalski encountered an issue with the Pieces Desktop App and created a GitHub issue.
* The Pieces Support Bot automatically triaged the issue and provided potential solutions and resources.
* Mark-at-Pieces investigated the issue and suspected a similarity to a previous case.

**Problems Identified:**

* Mariusz-kowalski experienced a problem with the Pieces Desktop App, possibly related to Linux machines.
* The specific cause of the issue was unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack-at-Pieces requested the log file and offered a video call for live troubleshooting.
* Mariusz-kowalski provided the log file but was unable to join the video call.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still being investigated. Mack-at-pieces will likely analyze the log file to diagnose the problem and suggest further solutions.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests potential recurring issues with the app on specific Linux machines.
* Mariusz-kowalski's additional information and engagement will help Pieces developers address the issue more efficiently.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Difficulty making requests to cloud services
    * Problems with local models

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests
* Insufficient hardware resources for local LLMs

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested logs for diagnosis
* Personal OpenApi key removed for cloud LLM issue
* Smaller local LLM used for local LLM issue

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Cloud LLM issue resolved by removing personal OpenApi key
* Local LLM issue likely resolved by using a smaller local LLM
* Rohanrathi99 scheduled a call with Mark-at-pieces to investigate further

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered calendar links for scheduling calls
* Rohanrathi99 provided access to requested logs via Google Drive

**Overall, the issue seems to be resolved. Further investigation is scheduled to confirm the local LLM solution and rule out other potential causes.**

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS and Ollama, resulting in installation failures, Cuda errors, and difficulties connecting to local or cloud LLMs. Solutions include reinstalling Ollama, checking system paths, verifying network connectivity, and ensuring sufficient hardware resources. Pieces OS updates address some compatibility issues, and direct support helps diagnose and resolve individual cases.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## GitHub Issue Summary: Ollama Installation Failure on Pieces

**Key Points Raised:**

* User waseem852 is unable to install Ollama in Pieces.
* The issue occurs regardless of installation method (via Pieces, manually, or winget).
* User confirms proper uninstallation and system restarts.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation fails to integrate with Pieces OS and Desktop.
* Cause of problem remains unidentified despite various troubleshooting attempts.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Brian from Pieces support suggested investigating the issue further through a call.
* A call was scheduled to diagnose the problem in real-time.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation ends with a scheduled call to resolve the issue.
* The outcome of the call and ultimate solution are not documented in this conversation.

**Additional Information:**

* The user was directed to relevant resources (similar issues, documentation, YouTube channel) while awaiting assistance.

**Next Steps:**

* Review the outcome of the scheduled call to determine the final solution.
* Update the issue with the resolution for future reference.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** User is experiencing Cuda errors related to Ollama when using Pieces OS.

**Key Points:**

* User installed Ollama via Pieces OS and encounters Cuda errors related to cublas64_12.dll.
* User attempts to reinstall Ollama directly with no success.
* User suspects startup order might be the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Faulty Ollama installation through Pieces OS.
* Potential race condition between Pieces OS and Ollama startup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User provides troubleshooting steps including uninstalling via Winget, reinstalling Ollama using the official installer, and checking the PATH variable.
* Pieces OS team pushes an update in version 11.1.2 to address potential race condition issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User reports the issue resolved after several uninstalls and path cleanups.
* User faces the issue again and provides further details about external Ollama instance detection.
* Pieces OS team acknowledges the issue and proposes a fix in version 11.1.2.

**Further Discussion:**

* User requests additional features for external Ollama instance detection and control within Pieces OS.
* Pieces OS team expresses willingness to investigate and discuss solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Difficulty making requests to cloud services
    * Problems with local models

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests
* Insufficient hardware resources for local LLMs

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested logs for diagnosis
* Personal OpenApi key removed for cloud LLM issue
* Smaller local LLM used for local LLM issue

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Cloud LLM issue resolved by removing personal OpenApi key
* Local LLM issue likely resolved by using a smaller local LLM
* Rohanrathi99 scheduled a call with Mark-at-pieces to investigate further

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered calendar links for scheduling calls
* Rohanrathi99 provided access to requested logs via Google Drive

**Overall, the issue seems to be resolved. Further investigation is scheduled to confirm the local LLM solution and rule out other potential causes.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch, often due to conflicts with other installations or OneDrive. Network connectivity problems also arise, hindering cloud service and local LLM access. Solutions involve checking for duplicate installations, resolving OneDrive conflicts, verifying network settings, and ensuring sufficient system resources.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* The user is experiencing issues with Pieces Desktop not launching on startup.
* The user is running Windows 10 and has Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop installed.
* Pieces Desktop is configured to launch on startup.
* PiecesOS is also trying to launch on startup, causing a conflict.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces Desktop is not launching on startup.
* PiecesOS is trying to update when the PC restarts, causing a conflict with Pieces Desktop.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The user is asked to confirm if Pieces Desktop or PiecesOS is configured to launch on startup.
* The user confirms that PiecesOS is configured to launch on startup.
* The user is advised to switch the startup app to Pieces Desktop instead.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user confirms that PiecesOS is the startup app.
* The user is waiting for a response from support on the recommended solution.

**Additional information:**

* The user is running Pieces for VS Code and experiencing crashes after 10 minutes.
* The crash message indicates that Pieces OS is not running.
* The user is unable to launch PiecesOS from the crash screen.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Functionality Issues

related_issues.title: Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
related_issues.text:
Horizontal scrolling doesn't work in JetbRains plugin
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Horizontal scroll within a code snippet from copilot answer is buggy. I cannot scroll horizontally back and forth to see full line. I need to select text to reach end of line. Once release, my cursor wont appear to scroll left again. Horizontal scrollbar doesn't respond and I cannot select text to left. cursor changes to a drag and drop cursor.

**Additional Notes**:

* The user was referred to similar issues and resources in the meantime.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Difficulty making requests to cloud services
    * Problems with local models

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests
* Insufficient hardware resources for local LLMs

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested logs for diagnosis
* Personal OpenApi key removed for cloud LLM issue
* Smaller local LLM used for local LLM issue

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Cloud LLM issue resolved by removing personal OpenApi key
* Local LLM issue likely resolved by using a smaller local LLM
* Rohanrathi99 scheduled a call with Mark-at-pieces to investigate further

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered calendar links for scheduling calls
* Rohanrathi99 provided access to requested logs via Google Drive

**Overall, the issue seems to be resolved. Further investigation is scheduled to confirm the local LLM solution and rule out other potential causes.**

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS launch issues:** This is a recurring and high-impact problem affecting users across different Pieces products. Focus on identifying the root causes, particularly conflicts with OneDrive and duplicate installations.

**Improve Ollama integration:** Address conflicts between Pieces OS and Ollama, including installation failures, Cuda errors, and connection problems. Enhance documentation and support resources to guide users on proper installation and configuration.

**Investigate and resolve account linking issues:** Address the persistent problem of account linking failures, especially for users with multiple accounts. The development of a new authentication system is a positive step, but ensure it effectively addresses these issues.

**Enhance communication and transparency:** Keep users informed about ongoing issues, planned fixes, and estimated resolution timelines. Provide clear and concise instructions for troubleshooting common problems.

**Gather more detailed diagnostics:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive logs and system information when reporting issues. This will help support teams diagnose problems more efficiently and identify potential patterns or trends.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for Pieces for Developers:** Given the specific issues and complexities related to Pieces for Developers, a dedicated support channel could provide more focused assistance and faster resolution times.

**Proactively monitor for common issues:** Implement systems to track and analyze support tickets, identifying recurring problems and emerging trends. This will enable proactive communication and faster resolution of widespread issues.

**Improve error messages:** Ensure error messages are clear, informative, and provide actionable steps for users to resolve problems. Vague error messages like "unable to reach cloud services" can be frustrating and hinder troubleshooting efforts.

**Develop automated solutions:** Explore opportunities to automate common support tasks, such as checking for duplicate installations, verifying network connectivity, or providing basic troubleshooting steps. This can free up support staff to focus on more complex issues.

**Continuously gather user feedback:** Implement mechanisms for users to provide feedback on their support experiences, including suggestions for improvement. Regularly review and analyze this feedback to identify areas for optimization and enhance the overall support process.
